name: AGameMode
doc:
GameMode is a subclass of GameModeBase that behaves like a multiplayer match-based game.
It has default behavior for picking spawn points and match state.
If you want a simpler base, inherit from GameModeBase instead.

NumBots: number of non-human players (AI controlled but participating as a player).
MinRespawnDelay: Minimum time before player can respawn after dying.
NumTravellingPlayers: Number of players that are still traveling from a previous map
InactivePlayerStateLifeSpan: Time a playerstate will stick around in an inactive state after a player logout
MaxInactivePlayers: The maximum number of inactive players before we kick the oldest ones out
bDelayedStart: Whether the game should immediately start when the first player logs in. Affects the default behavior of ReadyToStartMatch

methods.name: AbortMatch
methods.doc: Report that a match has failed due to unrecoverable error

methods.name: EndMatch
methods.doc: Transition from InProgress to WaitingPostMatch. You can call this manually, will also get called if ReadyToEndMatch returns true

methods.name: GetMatchState
methods.doc: Returns the current match state, this is an accessor to protect the state machine flow

methods.name: IsMatchInProgress
methods.doc: Returns true if the match state is InProgress or other gameplay state

methods.name: OnSetMatchState
methods.doc: Implementable event to respond to match state changes

methods.name: ReadyToEndMatch
methods.doc: Returns true if ready to End Match. Games should override this

methods.name: ReadyToStartMatch
methods.doc: Returns true if ready to Start Match. Games should override this

methods.name: RestartGame
methods.doc: Restart the game, by default travel to the current map

methods.name: Say
methods.doc: Exec command to broadcast a string to all players

methods.name: StartMatch
methods.doc: Transition from WaitingToStart to InProgress. You can call this manually, will also get called if ReadyToStartMatch returns true
